casebody.data:
Cromwell, Respondent, v. Black, Appellant. (Superior Court of New York City, General Term. December 10, 1891.) Action by William Nelson Cromwell, as assignee, against William F. Black. From order denying defendant’s motion for a further bill of particulars, defendant appeals.

Argued before Sedgwick, C. J., and Freedman and Dugro, JJ.

E. D. Hawkins, for appellant. W. J. Curtis, for respondent. Per Curiam.

The order should be affirmed, with $10 costs and disbursements.
